page_analysis.text_content:
Balconies, decks, & outdoor areas on upper floors
Outdoor areas on upper levels that are roofed DO count toward gross floor area regardless of the design
(including whether or not the sides are open).
An outdoor area on an upper floor is considered to be
roofed if the eave over that area is deeper than the eave
over the rest of the building. This may be illustrated by
comparing Roof Plans 1 & 2 of Fig 10.
Fig 10 Balconies
Roof plan 1
Roof plan 2
Roof Plan 1 Area A: Counts because it is roofed
Area B: Does not count because this arbor is substantially open
Area C: Does not count because the overhang is the same size as the over-
hang around the rest of the house and is considered to be open
Width of overhang
over the balcony
Width of overhang around
the rest of the house
C
B
A
Roof Plan 2 Area A: Counts because it is roofed
Area B: Counts because the overhang here is greater than the overhang
around the rest of the house, and considered to be roofed
Area C: Does not count because it is open
Width of overhang
over the balcony
Note: Pop-out balconies are
subject to the same evaluation.
Width of overhang around
the rest of the house

C
A

visual_elements.description: An isometric view of a building showing two upper-level outdoor areas, labeled 'Roof plan 1' and 'Roof plan 2', with different roofing structures. Roof plan 1 shows a pergola-like structure over part of the balcony, while Roof plan 2 shows a solid roof extending over the balcony.

Roof Plan 1: A top-down view of an outdoor area with three distinct sections labeled A, B, and C. Area A is hatched with diagonal lines, Area B is hatched with a grid pattern, and Area C is solid. There are labels indicating 'Width of overhang over the balcony' and 'Width of overhang around the rest of the house' with corresponding arrows.

Roof Plan 2: A top-down view of an outdoor area with three distinct sections labeled A, B, and C. Area A is hatched with diagonal lines, Area B is solid, and Area C is solid. There are labels indicating 'Width of overhang over the balcony' and 'Width of overhang around the rest of the house' with corresponding arrows.

structural_elements.main_heading: Balconies, decks, & outdoor areas on upper floors
subheadings: Outdoor areas on upper levels that are roofed DO count toward gross floor area regardless of the design

additional_notes: Page number '15' is located at the bottom right corner.
A grey box at the bottom left contains a 'Note' about pop-out balconies.

qualifiers.text: (including whether or not the sides are open)

conditions.text: Outdoor areas on upper levels that are roofed DO count toward gross floor area regardless of the design
An outdoor area on an upper floor is considered to be roofed if the eave over that area is deeper than the eave over the rest of the building.
Area A: Counts because it is roofed
Area B: Does not count because this arbor is substantially open
Area C: Does not count because the overhang is the same size as the over-hang around the rest of the house and is considered to be open
Area A: Counts because it is roofed
Area B: Counts because the overhang here is greater than the overhang around the rest of the house, and considered to be roofed
Area C: Does not count because it is open
Pop-out balconies are subject to the same evaluation.

logical_relationships.expression: IF an outdoor area on an upper level is roofed, THEN it DO counts toward gross floor area regardless of the design (including whether or not the sides are open).
IF the eave over an outdoor area on an upper floor is deeper than the eave over the rest of the building, THEN the outdoor area is considered to be roofed.
Conditions for Roof Plan 1 areas A, B, and C.
Conditions for Roof Plan 2 areas A, B, and C.

execution_sequence.action: Determine if an outdoor area on an upper level is roofed.
If roofed, count the area towards gross floor area, considering qualifier q1.
Apply specific counting rules for areas based on their roofing and openness characteristics, as illustrated in Roof Plan 1 and Roof Plan 2.
Apply the same evaluation criteria to pop-out balconies.
